item.title: Huge amount of rubbish in front garden, 18th January
item.description:
Reporting again as issue still exists. Huge amount of litter in front garden of 19 glasbrook road. Has been this way for at least 6 months. Very depressing to see.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glasbrook Road, Eltham

item.title: New Squire padlock required for vehicle gates, 18th January
item.description:
The old squire padlock has broken - the barrel just keep turning and won’t unlock. Galliard Homes have put a temporary replacement padlock on the chain for security, but we need a replacement Squire padlock so that we can get our cuttings removed and bins emptied. Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal use of parking post, 18th January
item.description:
In November 2025 someone had put a padlock in one of the designated parking despite not parking a vehicle and keeping the parking spot blocked for months. Is obstructing other permit holders to park and reducing the parking available in the area.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bradstock Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Cars being driven on the pavement., 18th January
item.description:
For quite some time we have had a problem on Osier Crescent where drivers have been driving on the pavement when a vehicle is coming in the opposite direction rather than following the Highway Code and the way being given safely by one of the road users. This action is not only in contravention of the Highway Code, but is also potentially life-threatening to anyone using the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Osier Crescent, Muswell Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple pot holes and uneven road surface., 18th January
item.description:
I am writing to raise an urgent concern regarding the extremely poor condition of Brookend Road. The road is riddled with multiple potholes, and the surface has become dangerously uneven throughout. There is now a patchwork of different surface types which creates an unsafe environment for cars, motorbikes, and cyclists alike. It is evident that the street has not been properly resurfaced in decades, and its current state poses a genuine risk to road users. I request that the council inspect Brookend Road as soon as possible and take immediate action to repair and resurface it to ensure the safety of everyone who relies on it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Brookend Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Excessive litter and flytipping from 67 Queen's Drive, 18th January
item.description:
Once again, the pavement outside this property has been left in an unacceptable condition due to fly-tipping and loose rubbish being spread across the public walkway. The waste is scattered widely, obstructing the pavement and neighbouring entrances.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queens Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
